title: Nathan Hinkson’s Resume
text:
540-422-6455 | nathan.hinkson@gmail.com | LinkedIn Profile



Bachelor of Science in Business Analytics
Brigham Young University - Idaho — Rexburg, Idaho
Minor: Automotive Technology
September 2021 – July 2025
- Area of Interest: Finance and Consulting
- Cumulative GPA: 3.55
- Scholarship: Brigham Young University - Idaho Academic Grant
- Relevant Coursework: Advanced Data Analytics, Predictive Modeling, Data Visualization, Financial Analytics, Business Strategy, SQL, Python, R, PowerBI, Tableau




Business Analytics Intern
Be Ready Enterprises LLC — Fredericksburg, Virginia
April 2024 – July 2024
- Enhanced daily operations by managing customer service interactions and streamlining sales processes.
- Developed and launched an e-commerce store, including product uploads, website design, and pre-launch preparation.
- Leveraged third-party services to increase product visibility and boost online sales.
- Conducted comprehensive industry analysis, evaluating competition, costs, revenues, and margins to devise actionable strategic plans for the company’s future.
Student Consultant
Small Business Management - “Barter Idaho” — Rexburg, Idaho
June 2023 – July 2023
- Consulted with a team of three other individuals to research and create a business plan for an Idaho Bartering organization.
- Devised liability waiver and transaction record templates to ensure the organization could run legally in Idaho.
- Clarified community needs by utilizing surveys to discover how “Barter Idaho” could fulfill needs by hosting bi-weekly bartering events.
Welder/Fitter
Cives Steel Corp — Ucon, Idaho
November 2022 – April 2023
- Mobilized as a team to match and exceed weekly shop goals for production.
- Safely operated cranes around 5-10 team members in a warehouse environment to move steel beams weighing several thousand pounds.
- Measured, built, and welded structural steel beams to be within 1/8” tolerance and meet customer and AWS standards.
Teacher’s Assistant
Automotive Lab: Electrical Systems/Engine Performance — Rexburg, Idaho
April 2022 – June 2022
- Led students in diagnosing and repairing actual customer vehicles within 2-3 lab periods.
- Trained students in applying theoretical knowledge of engine performance and electrical problems, ensuring enough practical experience in one semester for future success.




Full-Time Volunteer LDS Church
England London Mission — London, England
May 2019 – May 2021
- Served a 24-month service mission to educate people about the Church and serve the people of England.
- Managed a full-time schedule routinely working 10-12 hours per day for 24 months.
- Increased missionary effectiveness by providing training in individual communication, problem-solving, and working strategy skills.
- Adapted work to meet legal requirements during the COVID-19 pandemic.
- Led through quantitative goal setting, reviewing past goals, learning new teaching/outreach methods, and increasing team member morale.
- Coordinated activities with religious and civic groups to provide community service and enhance exposure to local church services.
